osvSchema.details: pkg_postinst in the Gentoo ebuild for Slurm through 22.05.3 unnecessarily calls chown to assign root's ownership on files in the live root filesystem. This could be exploited by the slurm user to become the owner of root-owned files.

description_data.value: pkg_postinst in the Gentoo ebuild for Slurm through 22.05.3 unnecessarily calls chown to assign root's ownership on files in the live root filesystem. This could be exploited by the slurm user to become the owner of root-owned files.

descriptions.value: pkg_postinst in the Gentoo ebuild for Slurm through 22.05.3 unnecessarily calls chown to assign root's ownership on files in the live root filesystem. This could be exploited by the slurm user to become the owner of root-owned files.

pkg_postinst en Gentoo ebuild para Slurm hasta 22.05.3 llama innecesariamente a chown para asignar la propiedad de root a los archivos en el sistema de archivos root activo. Esto podría ser aprovechado por el usuario de slurm para convertirse en propietario de los archivos de propiedad root.
